impact-statement: The amino acids that are necessary for phospholipid scrambling by ANO6/TMEM16F can, via domain swapping, confer scrambling activity to the chloride ion channel ANO1 that normally does not scramble phospholipids.

competing-interest.conf1: The authors declare that no competing interests exist.

equal-contrib.equal-contrib: These authors contributed equally to this work

contribution.con1: KY, Conceived and designed experiments, Performed and analyzed all patch clamp experiments, Prepared figures, Wrote the manuscript
contribution.con2: JMW, Contributed to experimental design, Performed and analyzed scrambling experiments, Helped write the manuscript
contribution.con3: KL, Assisted with phospholipid scrambling experiments, Tissue culture, Helped to write and edit the manuscript
contribution.con4: EAO, Assisted with development and analysis of homology models
contribution.con5: YYC, Designed and made all the cDNA constructs, chimeras, and mutants, Maintained tissue culture, Performed transfections
contribution.con6: HCH, Conceived and designed experiments, Performed and analyzed scrambling experiments, Edited figures, Wrote the manuscript
